reviews.text: We stayed at this property for one night after our cruise on March 19th. We had noticed the property on previous trips to San Juan. We arrived early (they always kick you off the ships by 10AM) and even though the hotel seemed empty, we couldn't check in until 4PM so we pretty much had a wasted day. Walked the "beach" for a few minues but it turned out to be a small strip of sand with rocks at one end and a busy bridge and traffic at the other. As well, the beach was crowded with locals with loud boom boxes and a couple guys trying to sell us drugs. The hotel lobby area looks tired and almost appears under construction. The whole property just looks "tired". When we finally got to our room, it was strangly configured with the toilet, shower (no tub), closets, bar fridge etc all in one room and the beds in another. So if the toilet was busy, forget about someone else getting clothes, ice or anything else. Our son jumped in the shower,only to find that the shower drain was plugged, flooding the room. We had to use all the towels to soak up the water. Called the front desk but no one seemed to care. Called again and still nothing. Finally gave up..no towels, no shower for the rest of our stay. The room faced the street and the street noise was unbelievable. Must be single pane glass which provided little noise protection. All in all, far, far below what one wouild expect from a Conrad property. Go on down the street to the Marriott, the Ritz or any one of the beautiful hotels that are "actually on the beach". Forget this place, its not worthy of the Conrad name or your money!

TV looks like a computer monitor, no real desk or table, no bathrobe. Tile floor makes it look very utilitarian. Bathroom is very tight--just barely enough room for 1 person. Common areas very retro looking (or just old) and not to my taste. Here on business so did not check out other amenities. Good points here--Pikayo restaurant and Starbucks near entrance. I will try someplace else next time.

reviews.text: We arrived at the Wyndham Condado for a three night stay over the weekend. I was a little nervous, after reading some of the reviews here. However, I was overall satisfied with our stay. Check in was fine. Staff were curtious and attentive. I joined Wyndham by Request, and when we arrived, our choice of wine and cheese were there. Very nice. We are not gamblers, but the casino was jumping. We played tennis in the morning, and there was no problem getting a reservation. Our room was well cleaned, sheets included, every morning. For the price we paid, I believe this is a good value. To be honest, there were a few things that caught our eye: This hotel does need a facelift. Carpets and walls were well worn. Our room was nice, but overall things could be updated. I am not usually petty; however, the condition of the carpets in the hallways really stood out, and gave this hotel a "motel" feel. If you prefer a beach setting this is not your place. The beach is tiny. The pool area is nice. If you have children they will love the water slide. Overall the pool/beach area was just ok. Again, hate to complain - just pointing out a few problems. We chose to take the C10- .25 cent bus to Ocean Park beach. Now there is a beach!! Beautiful. On a good note: The bed, and down comforters, and pillows were excellent. Very Very comfortable. Shower pressure, excellent (which is a definate plus in the Carribean!). We took the advice of some previous posters and headed down the block to La Hacienda for an absolute delicious breakfast next to the open windows overlooking the ocean. Our check for two was never over $15.00. (B'fast at the hotel is $18.00 per person!). Definately stay away from the hotel restaurants in general. They are so overprice, and service is usually so-so. There is a small coffee shop on the street at the bottom of the entrance of the hotel that sells great coffee and snacks all day, again, much less expensive than inside the hotel. reviews.text: My sister and I just returned from a 3 night stay at the Wyndham Condado Plaza. We found everything there to our liking. At first glance from the cab ride from the airport, we were disappointed in the view of the lagoon and wished we were staying on a resort on the ocean. However, we discovered the beautiful grassy knoll on the hotel grounds above the ocean crashing on the rocks. Plenty of comfortable chaises, chairs, tables and hammocks. Beautiful ocean breezes. We ate lunch at the pool bar every day and found the prices and service wonderful. We discovered 2 great places for breakfast and dinner within a very short walk from the hotel. We had full eggs/bacon breakfasts at the Nueva Hacienda by the open windows overlooking the ocean crashing on the rocks. Breakfasts were around $5 and wonderful, especially the coffee with steamed milk. The Waikiki next door was even more scenic as we sat outside on the terrace and again watched the ocean crashing on the rocks beneath us. Meals were under $20 for dinner. One night we went to a highly recommened restaurant, called Ajili Mojily (slightly more high end) on the lagoon side. We didn't have a table with a view, but had an enjoyable meal with a very friendly staff, and the highest price meal was around $26. The casino at the Condado Plaza was good size for Puerto Rico and we had fun there too. Even though we had a City View (cheapest) room, we had a slight view from the balcony of the lagoon and the kayak races across the street. FYI, I booked our rooms through Expedia, so the Wyndham would not accept our membership for the welcome baskets or room upgrades. They only honor membership if you book directly through the Wyndham reservation desk. I never did get to try the brownie sundae highly recommended on this site, but it was under $5 even though the ice cream parlor was in the hotel. I found the prices of meals in San Juan and even in the hotel to be quite reasonable (in comparison to Ft. Lauderdale, FL). We thoroughly enjoyed our trip and stay in Puerto Rico and will plan to go back there again.

reviews.title: Wyndham Condado
reviews.text: Just returned from 8 days in the British Virgin Islands and decided to explore Puerto Rico on the way back. We stayed 3 nights at the Wyndham Condado, April 1, 2 and 3, 2005. We'd heard some awful reviews, but our friends had booked the hotel for 1 night and we just decided to extend the stay and remain at the Wyndham Condado. We loved it and Puerto Rico both!......We registered with Wyndham by Request as suggested in advance. Check in took 5 minutes maximum. We had a room over looking the bay across the street. The room was clean and spacious. Nice view of the bay with a small patio. Room had a coffe maker and tea always kept stocked each day. Wyndham by Request left beer, fruit and cheese and water in our room on day 2. My boyfriend is a picky eater....so when he finds a restaurant he likes, it's hard to get him anywhere else....as a result we ate dinner each night in the Italian Restaurant located in the hotel. Food was great (we always had one of the specials, Mahi-mahi or medallions of beef with pasta on the side) and a glass of wine, all very good. Dinner ran about $75 per night for both of us. Breakfast at the hotel is expensive. About $30 for your basic eggs, bacon, toast breakfast. There is an extensive buffet for about $18 per person. The casino is small (of course we go to Las Vegas quite a bit, so there's no comparison), too many nickel slots. Our friend sat at one of the black-jack tables and complained about it taking 45 minutes to get a drink. ....My complaint: Most machines require a hand-pay for any jackpots over $50.00 - $100.00 and on 3 occassions I sat for more than 45 minutes each time waiting to get paid.

Things to do: We took a cab to see the forts and explore Old San Juan on foot the first day. Our cab driver took us to Fort (Cristobal?) and we began exploring this fort first, great veiws Old San Juan and the wall extending all the way to the 2nd fort (El Morro?). Beautiful walk along the coast connects the 2 forts with vendors selling things on the stroll from one to the next. So many kids flying kites when you arrive at El Morro - a beautiful sight!.....Then, we had "Frommers Puerto Rico" and it contains a map and walking tour of Old San Juan that really helps you to know what the buildings are that you're seeing, (highly recommended). One thing it doesn't mention that you must do, (told to us by our cab driver), when you stop at the Old Church, proceed directly across the street and walk down to the bottom of the hill to see the only remaining gate to the city built by the Spanish. (there were originally 6 gates). Another beautiful spot. 2nd day booked a tour right from the hotel, the Rio Muy Caves and Arecibo Observatory. Caves were amzing. Took about 1 1/2 hours from the hotel by van. You travel in a tram down to the cave entrance (it's massive!) and you go on a walking tour with a guide for a bit over an hour). Not much to see at Arecibo, but it is an amazing sight if you remember the movie "Contact" with Jodie Foster - it's there! - There's a room with lots of scientific interactive things to do, but we enjoyed it. Back to the hotel and we enjoyed the salsa music and watched the great dancers right in the hotel that night!....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3. Great big bathrooms, although there were no doors to close (sideways, gap between door and wall). So, technically anyone could see through the double door. No problem in our case.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

likes.liked: — Great Food and Pool Area, trendy and great atmosphere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were great with a great view. They were very stylish and clean. Stupid, but the shampoo and conditioner were actually something I liked using. The staff was helpful and pleasant. The bars, pools, restaurants were good. Be warned the prices were off the chart... I recommend going into Old San Juan to eat or drink anything. The Condado is right on the buss line to Old San Juan. The casino was not crowded and you could always get a machine or a table. The bar was was hip and had a young and beautiful crowd. There were always chairs and space around the pool. The price for our stay was very reasonable; we paid about $111 a night after getting the 4th night free I plan to return.
reviews.title: Beautiful and Convenient

reviews.text: Let me start by saying it is a beautiful resort on a wonderous island. However, when we got there we noticed quite a few things. The check in was obscenely long. When we finally got to the room which as supposed to be the family suite we were literally on top of eachother it was so small. This was reluctantly remedied by Henry, the manger on duty the next day. I was then given a key to a room that was not programed to my new room. There were insufficient supplies in the room for it being a family suite and all. The hotel employees, with the exception of Sammy at the AquaGrill lack customer service skills something terrible. My rental car was damaged in the underground hotel parking lot where there are no security cameras. My thought was that someone had to have been inebriated and backed in to it without a care in the world. There are hidden costs for everything. Although you pay a resort tax this doesn't include use of the tennis court without an additional fee nor does it include the $5 pp/per night, regardless of age, room fee to name few. We never mind spending the money. After all, we are on vacation. It's when it is by surprise and with an attitude that even us NY'ers wouldn't dream of excercising that it becomes discouraging.
reviews.title: Not all it's cracked up to be

likes.disliked: — Customer service and all that implies

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms, lobby and hotel were attractive, but we had several problems, such as our room not being ready for an hour and a half past check-in time. Also, our balcony had a huge electric cable swinging free across one corner of it which didn't exactly make for a pristine ocean view. Both of the bathroom's electrical outlets did not work, so I had to dry my hair in the bedroom, plus the shower exuded a strong septic smell every time it was used. The final straw, though, was the horribly leaky shower that released a stream of water across the bathroom floor each time one of us showered. This leak caused my husband to fall, which then led to us changing rooms. Good points: the pool, overall cleanliness, and the pool bar.
reviews.title: A Bit Overrated.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ok so i booked using the hotel website and my plane tix by jetblue.....the decor of the hotel is very nice and modern which i loved. Carol at the front desk was a complete ditz! she didnt help at all. Henry at concierge desk was the best!!! so was yaritza!!! the beach is very small but it was ok for me. very clean considering the locals can use the same beach. PR in general is clean. we went out to Old San Juan and rite down the street in a ocean view small restraunt and ate as the hotel was expensive. we did use our 50 credit promotion and ate at the strip house. the food is VERY expensive but soooooooooooo good....we had steak and it was fabulous and so was the desert!! at night the lobby lounge was fun. my only complaint was that PR has lots of mosquitos so bring off!!!!!!!! i left PR and im home and i still feel itchy!!!!!!!!! this is a reason why i may not go back to PR in general.....we rented a car for 50.00 with tax and insurance a day and drove to El Yunque ourselves which the hotel provided charlies rental car and provided great directions!!! so dont do the rainforest excursion when u ccan do it urself for cheaper!!! overall it was a relaxing, great experience and i do recommend el condado!!!! go to isla verde and see how nice the beach is!!!
reviews.title: Pretty Good

reviews.text: The Italian restaurant, Gusto di Italia, was very reasonable & good for a hotel restaurant. They serve breakfast, lunch, and dinner. The service is friendly and the view of the ocean makes dining there very pleasant. The other restaurant, Strips, is VERY over-priced. Around $37 for just a steak and $10 for a baked potato. You'd have to be crazy to eat there!
reviews.title: Very Accomadating
Fantastic Stay!!
reviews.text: Down the block are other dining options. La Hacienda is OK for breakfast. Ropa Vieja was very good 2 1/2 years ago, but we didn't enjoy our dinner this time. The prices have gone up, the portions are very small and the service is indifferent. Surprisingly, it's a very popular place. Forget Chili's across the street. It's very noisy, crowded, and pedestrian, Ajili Mojili is good if you like Puerto Rican food.

Spent 4 days from 7/25-29 and had a great time. Beach and pool area are very clean. There's a chinese restaurants on first floor that serves great food. The restaurants around the area are good, theres a Chili's down the block. But beware that there are many taxes that inflate your bill. There was an issue with the on site laundry room. Several washers and dryer were off line. When front desk staff (Yaritza) was informed they resolved issues by having my wet clothes dryed,pressed and boxed free of charge. Thank you. I had an awesome time and would return with out hesitation.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay, wonderful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had an excellent experience at the Condado Plaza. Our room was in the Ocean Tower. The roop was very well decorated, modern art deco. The bathroom was very large and spacious. Casino was lots of fun. Staff was great! Had breakfast once in the hotel; it was decent. The pool and small beach area was a lot of fun. I especially enjoyed the bar/lounge in the evening. IT was a nice atmosphere with DJ playing music. Had a fantastic experience and will definitely return.
reviews.title: ALWAYS AWESOME

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nicely renovated hotel, three great pools to choose from. My tip would be to check the hotel sites specials, we were American Express cardholders so we got a free upgrade, 75$ resort credit, & complimentary bottle of wine. I would recommend a little restaurant right down the street called Hacienda, we got breakfast there almost every morning for like 7 bucks a person & it was really good food with an excellent view!
reviews.title: Definately Recommend

reviews.text: I was a little hesitant about the hotel after reading several reviews but decided it was only 1 night pre-cruise. I'm happy to report that I found this hotel to be a first class establishment. We checked in the middle of the afternoon and so my request for an upgrade was no problem. Instead of a city view we were oceanfront. The staff at the front desk were always very nice and helpful. Our room was spacious, very modern with a huge bathroom all recently renovated. The pool area was beautiful and large enough that it didn't feel crowded..This was a great way to begin our vacation.
reviews.title: Condado Plaza is fabulous

reviews.text: Just came back from this vacation wishing that the service of this hotel would've been as nice at the grounds. I have to say that i was impressed with the change of this hotel. It is absolutely beautiful. The problems start when you do your check in. We had booked a room for 5 days, when we got there they had it for 3. When my husband asked to get the 2 extra days he mentioned the special that they had, stay 4 nights and the 5th one is free, the girl said that we cannot have it because our reservation was for 3 days. My husband explained to her again that we wanted to stay 5 days not 3 and that we like to get the special but the girl at front desk didn't even tried to get the special she just said no that we can't have it.
reviews.title: Goos looking place, terrible service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Got to the room and it was comfortable and well decorated. We had what they called a family suite. Two twin beds for the kids, separated from our side of the bed room. Also we had the coffee machine and the microwave. Everything was nice and clean.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel, but unattractive room

reviews.text: The pool on the Ocean tower is really nice and has a cool slide that kids and adults enjoy.
reviews.title: Joey, Another Teq-ini Please

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best thing that could have happened to us was that our originally booked hotel, At Wind Chimes Inn, lost our reservation and so we ended up at this wonderful hotel. Yes, it was much more expensive and we spent way more than we had planned on, but it was worth every penny. This place is amazing and the service was fantastic. We were upgraded to an ocean view room, which was just beautiful and had an awesome view. The bathroom was enormous, and yes, contained the closet, the minibar, and the coffee maker. However, it’s laid out in such a way that it does not seem odd. The room, as well as the hotel itself is very minimalist and modern with a definite South Beach feel. If you’re looking for that tropical, Caribbean look this is not it.
reviews.title: Unexpected but Terrific Stay

likes.liked: — service, room, pool scene, convenient location to everything
likes.disliked: — the hefty resort fee and resort tax (over 75 dollars a day)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pools are terrific with great service from the pool bar/restaurant, the Aqua Grill. The drinks are good, albeit expensive, and the food is perfect for lunch with sandwiches and salads. The shrimp brochettes with avocado were to die for. The pool bar is also a nice place to have a couple of drinks at night before heading out to dinner, or for a more trendy feel, try the lobby bar or the bar at the Strip House. All have wonderful service.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Nice Location, Good Food, Fabulous Pool

likes.disliked: — nothing really,except they shld play some cool music at the pool. I was advised to turn off my ipod stereo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My fiancé and I visited the Conrad San Juan on Feb 12-14 for Valentine’s day weekend and we could not have been more pleased with the facility and the service, especially in light of the lower then stellar Trip Advisor rating of #7 (although it appears the vast majority of the negative reviews which have brought the rating down were posted prior to the renovation which is unfortunate as it clearly should be much higher). I would agree with others in that this is no higher than a 4.0 star hotel as indicated by the Trip Advisor rating. Many of the weekend guests are 1-night only cruise goers departing the next day (either Sat or Sun) so there’s no real time to fix an issue that someone might have with their room. The Conrad was booked to capacity for the weekend as were other 3 and 4 star hotels which range from $200-$350/night.
reviews.title: A wonderful hotel! Would gladly return again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am a Hilton Honors member, so generally stay at Hampton Inns and Homewood Suites on business and then use my points for either Embassy Suites or Doubletree hotels along the Florida east coast a couple times a year. We wanted to get away for a long weekend although only just planned it a week in advance and decided to travel to San Juan. The Doubletree was my first choice as it was rated #2 on Trip Advisor, although when I learned they don’t have balconies (a must for my fiancé) I looked elsewhere. The two Caribe Hilton’s and the Conrad all have balconies but were completely booked so I waited another day and the Conrad opened up. I was a little concerned by the recent negative posts, and so as he suggests, I contacted Jose Padin (Dir of Ops) and he said that any issues noted in past reviews had been resolved and that we should contact him directly on his mobile if we had any problems during our stay so I booked our weekend at the Conrad with full expectation of being satisfied with the decision, and in the end, we clearly were as I had no reason to call him, other than to say thank you!
reviews.title: Wish we could have stayed longer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One of the “10 ways you know you’re in Puerto Rico” is that everyone claps upon the plane touching down at the airport so don’t be surprised when that happens.
reviews.title: hotel is lovely;service is outstanding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As this was our first visit to Puerto Rico and I only had the Trip Advisor posts to go on, I wanted to provide a more detailed review of the hotel and area to help others and so did a little more walking around then I perhaps normally would have at a hotel.
reviews.title: Not up to Conrad standards

reviews.text: Timezone - Puerto Rico is on Atlantic Standard Time (AST) and does not employ daylight savings time so from May-Oct is on the same time as the east coast, and 1 hour ahead from Nov-April.
reviews.title: Modern with easy access to old San Juan

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stood at the Condado 3 years ago, and decided to go back. The hotel is newly redone, and quite beautiful. We like the fact that it is in the city and we can try all the wonderful restaurants nearby. The rooms are all redone and very clean. I don't however like the fact that the refrigator and coffee maker are in the bathroom. The bathroom is very large and spotless! The bathroom doors need LOCKS, (no locks on the doors). The beach is very, very small, that is the biggest downfall for this hotel, you have no privacy at all. The lagoon is wonderful if you don't like waves, and also clean. The staff is very friendly and helpful, we would stay here again!
reviews.title: Very much improved from 3 years ago!

likes.disliked: — The tiny beach on the main road

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived on New Years Day in the evening. We left our cab and walked into an empty lobby. We were told to take the elevator, walk past the casino, over a skywalk to the other building where we were told we would find the hotel's desk. The desk turned out to be a banquet table in a hall. It was not an aspicious start. Once we checked in, we were assigned a room and had to walk back over the skywalk, past the casino to the elevator, hauling our carry-ons and coats. My husband says you only have one chance to make a good impression and this hotel blew it! We had a remodeled room, one with the closet in the bathroom, which seemed unusual. Our room itself was beautiful with a great view. But putting one's clothes in the same area as the shower seems very odd. We ate at the sushi bar and at the Italian cafe and were pleased with the food and service. After the first evening we rarely saw people in the halls or cafes. It was difficult to feel that we were at a nice resort -- there was absolutley no resort feel to the place. Walking time and again into the empty first floor lobby was just not pleasant! Our major gripe was with the Concierge. We called and asked for restaurant recommendations. We were told that ____ (home of the Pina Colada) was great! We went and were served food which appeared to us to have been cooked much earlier in the day. The next day we called the Concierge again and asked for further recommendations. We were given the name of the same place. Trying to get something different we asked the Concierge for another suggestion. We were told she was busy at the moment and would call us back. She never did, although we waited. So, we went to Marmalade in Old Town San Juan and were delighted. The call back from the Concierge never came, but we didn't care. We went to Marmalade the next night too! All in all, I didn't think that this hotel gives good value for the money. And this is the first time I have ever given a hotel a less than glowing recommendation on this forum.
reviews.title: A Mixed Reaction

likes.disliked: — Concierge was not helpful and didn't call back when she said she would.

reviews.title: Relaxing vacation
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel for a week in January, and although the first day wasn't great, the remainder of our stay went well. When we checked in we were given a room with a broken balcony door; when I called I was offered to have maintenance come and "take a look" at it. I told them to provide me with another room and then they can send a maintenace person to fix that room, as I am not on vacation to sit and wait for a door to be fixed.

Wow.... what a difference a few years make. This place is outstanding. The renovation is spectacular and very chic. From the lobby, to the rooms, to the restaraunts, to the pools, and outside grounds, this place sparkles!
reviews.title: Awesome!!! Totally renovated, rejuvenated & ready for you!!!

likes.disliked: — Having to leave to go to La Concha Resort.

reviews.text: I was traveling with my 2 teens and they were also taken back by the change in the whole atmosphere of this resort. It was cool and chic and everything was new.
reviews.title: Mixed Thoughts

reviews.text: We stayed here on 2/14/08 for one night, and then moved over to the La Concha for 5 nights, and what a mistake that was. I regret not booking my whole stay at Condado Plaza.
reviews.title: Perhaps things are better now...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Checking in was a breeze we immediately changed into our bathing suits to check out the pools. We stayed in the ocean side building and there were 2 pools, one even had salt water, which is more enjoyable than chlorine. The pool area is unbelievable, the young man got our towels and our chairs ready, for a moment I almost thought I was staying at the Ritz. There is great kids water slide and a nice swim up bar in one pool. There are a few private secluded areas that looked very romantic, and there was a tent set up for massages by the sea. Although the beach is public, there was security and it was safe. One of the greatest things to do is to grab one of the many hammocks and just relax under the palm trees.
reviews.title: Would definitely stay there again

reviews.text: The view from the room was really breathtaking and the sounds of the crashing waves against the sea wall were so soothing. Everything was new and in working order in the room, and the bathroom was huge and had plenty of storage for clothes. The towels were thick and soft and the bathroom supplies were plentiful. Two people could easily be in there at a time with plenty of room leftover, compared to La Concha where the door almost hits your knees when sitting down.
reviews.title: Excellent service

reviews.text: I was given another room right away. Upon entering the new room, I went onto the balcony to see the view, only to find that my "city view" room was a view of a building next door under construction with a man hanging on a rope painting, and dirt splattered all over the balcony . In addition, there were only 3 tiny drawers to unpack clothing etc. , and they were located in the bathroom as was the mini fridge and coffee maker! Yes, you read right! The bathroom and closet and mini fridge are all in 1 room behind a sliding door. (I can't imagine why one would need to have their shower/toilet in the same vicinity as their coffee maker and clothing?)
reviews.title: Outstanding Service, Beautifully Renovated Hotel

likes.disliked: — noise from hallway and adjoining room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2004, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I placed another call to the front desk and was told there weren't any other rooms available . I asked to speak to the manager and the manager told me the same, she said that she would call me back later in the day if anything came up. I waited for her call and got no call.
reviews.title: Lively fun on the strip

likes.liked: — The excitement surrounding the hotel itself, the entire area, how much there was to do

reviews.text: As most my reviews involve long term stays this hotel is like the other "resorts" in San Juan Puerto Rico: nice for a day or so which should suit the tourists escaping from colder climates and throwing money around but not the greatest for a long term stay. But Conrad does deserve some credit and I'll give it some now. The pool/beach area is nice. Multiple pools, jacuzzis, swim up bar, restaurant, hammocks, beach, all along the ocean front. Food/drink wise, like all the other nearby hotels, food and drinks are pricey. Order a few beers at a bar or restaurant with a friend and you'll have a decent tab running pretty quickly. Now lets talk food. The Conrad has three or four restaurants. One a bit upper scale but the others somewhat more reasonable with one exception. The upper scale Piyako's is nice but its too pricey for the experience. Again if you are on a roll through money vacation it wont probably bother you. Another place to mention: their asian based restaurant: called Nine. But that's in name only. As it's not much of a restaurant if atmosphere matters to you. As Nine is simply a sushi like bar and a few tables with chairs alongside the hotel's entire casino. When you sit at Nine you share the ambiance of twenty to thirty slot machines and all the noise the comes from the casino. Nine is VERY expensive and an even worse a bad value. Its extremely overpriced for the quality and menu. Unless you like burning fifty dollar bills stay away from Nine. The only pleasure you may get from it is the smile of the 4-6 Chinese waitresses with the incredible tip you're going to pay her after you see your tab. There's much better options for Japanese food. One very close to the hotel.
reviews.title: A business traveler's review

reviews.text: Back to the hotel. The rooms are nice. The nightly turn up service deserves praise if you don't mind your door being knocked on between 5-7PM. The room's FREE internet service is very good. The separate bathroom with the glass enclosed shower is a nice touch. Complaints: the air conditioning always made the room feel cold whenever it came on regardless of the setting. A c ouple of times over three weeks the faucet water in the room was brown and had a bad odor. I had to run the water for like 15 minutes to get clear water. No in room microwave was disappointing.
reviews.title: Don't stay here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lastly the location. On that side of Condado there's just not a lot of dining options. There is a Chilis and another higher end place next to it. A couple of beach front bar/restaurants and one other higher end place but the other side of Condado has much better options, I do not care to drive in San Juan. So walking distance places matter a lot to me after the rental car is parked for the day.
reviews.title: Puerto Rico is Breathtaking, Conrad Condado is Disappointing

reviews.text: In summary the San Juan Conrad is a overall nice place. It has plenty of options and distractions for a short visit. It's business model plays upon tourists that want to have fun and not worry as much about their wallets as they enjoy themselves. But if I had to stay again I'd probably stay on the other side of Condado at the Marriott.
reviews.title: Great view; excellent staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Conrad after a caribbean cruise...Celebrity Summit...wonderful cruise and ship! We had to stay here for a meeting. I had read the reviews about the beach and pool but for us, those parts were just fine. There's a lovely grassy area with plenty of loungs and th esnorkeling off shore was pretty good. For us th eproblems were the food..it was dreadful! Ajili Moliji and Rpoa Viejo both a short walk were much better! The rooms are ok but the bathrooms are very, very tiny. The rugs byt he bed were old and full of stains. We stayed for 4 nites and evryday we were told there weren't any clean towels in the afternoon because they were all in the laundry...quite surprising for a hotel of this size. Also, they tack on a porterage fee if you are part of a group even if you don't arrive as a group so you end up tipping twice. The hotel is also lovated in a rather ugly part of town and there's absolutely no where to take a walk. We will never stay here again!
reviews.title: Kinda cool, smokers everywhere.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is pretty nice from prospect of location. Yet for a reserved in advance $300/night ocean-view room they offered me a laguna-view room, which is cheaper on their own site. Then, after a fight with a manager, they offered a 2nd floor room with ocean-view. But the room was filthy with sperm-stains on a couch and suspicious debris on the floor. (see pics). After another heated argument with administration they changed room to a "handicapped room" with ocean view, but wi-fi didn't working there despite their promise that it is working. I had to go to my previous sperm-stained room and get a cord to connect computer. Room was clean this time, yet there is so many signs of fatigue in the bathroom, floors etc which should not be in a 5 star hotel. I will not stay there again.
reviews.title: Beautiful location but need remodeling

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First of all the previous reviewer was very dramatic. What do you expect them to do change out a mattress in 24 hours..they probably didn't even notice until you pointed it out. And everyone has a bad day..don't blame the concierge for everything. Yes this hotel has a vibrant lobby, but I did not hear it from my room. And it is fun and convenient, you can get dressed up and go down for a couple drinks, then to the casino adjacent. This was a very modern, CLEAN hotel and very fun! I travel once a month, I work for an airline so I'm always somewhere, and this is one of the nicest hotels I have stayed in. Nice, modern, fresh lobby, has a very miami vibe. Great DJ on the weekends. The rooms are modern and clean, comfortable bed (definetly spring for the ocean front room..it makes all the difference!) The view can't be beat, and the waves crashing onto the rocks while you sleep is sure to slip you into a great calming dream :) The staff was totally nice and so helpful. Didn't have a problem with anyone and I stayed for 5 days. The facilities are very nice, great gym, two outdoor hot tubs, and big clean pools. It has a beach on the side which is also a public beach but very safe and clean. Small but lovely, it is on a lagoon which on sunny days is perfect for snorkeling! This is a great base for exploring the island or for before or after a cruise. I had a great time! I have also stayed at the Hilton Caribe across the way and I prefer this hotel.
reviews.title: Fabulous time, Fabulous Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I should have read the reviews here before I booked as there is a common theme regarding the cleanliness and lack of service. We arrived late and were told on check in that our ocean front room booked 2 months before was not available. We were put in a room off in a wing that was not connected to the main part of the hotel. The room was unclean and adjoined another room which was something we specifically asked not to happen. Again we were told that there were no other rooms available until the next day. We were exhausted and just wanted our bags from the concierge. We waited 2 hours for our bags and every time we called to complain we were told they were on the way. Once we had our bags we got ready for bed. Upon pulling the covers back we discovered that they had made the bed with fresh sheets over top of a dirty mattress cover. The cover had a big puddle of mentsrual blood on it from a previous guest. DISGUSTING!
reviews.title: Horrifying- Blood stains in the bed.....seriously.

reviews.text: The more revolting part is that when we called to complain to the manager he didn't care and complained that is was 3am and what did we expect him to do at that hour.
reviews.title: Great hotel, certainly does not deserve the negative reviews. One of the best in Puerto Rico.

reviews.text: The worst experience we have ever had, 3rd world countries have better hotels than this.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: We were coming back from a cruise on Saturday and our flight was cancelled due to weather. We decided to stay another night in Puerto Rico. Much better than getting stuck in Detroit! I went to Trip Advisor and found this hotel. It wasn't cheap but it was wonderful! The lobby and room were very well decorated. There was a great balcony. The beach and resort area was great. We went snorkeling right off the beach. The water was a little cloudy because the surf was high but we still saw hundreds of colorful fish. The beds were so comfortable I felt like I was drugged when I slept.
reviews.title: Fabulous!

reviews.text: we arrived 11:00a.m.- the front desk greeted us with a welcome and immediatly gave us a key to our room- though check-in was hours away. We opened the door to a room tht looked exactly as it does on the website. The bed was the most comfortable hotel bed I have EVER slept in! The staff was exceptional! ex: Carlos from housekeeping- day 1 I went to a cart outside my room to ask if I could have a few more coffee packets- he gave them to me with a smile- instead of acting like I was keeping him from doing his job- the next day I went to a cart outside my room -again it was Carlos, he smiled and said "coffee- regular not decaf, right?" he remembered what I wanted and that detail made me feel very welcomed and at home. another example - Michelle, our poolside server, was very accommodationg- to us, and those seated at the pool around us- we ordered breakfast poolside- one morning it must have been 11:30 by the time we ordered and instead of saying "no" and handing us the lunch menu in her hand- she went back to the kitchen to get us the breakfast menu and check with the kitchen to see if it was o.k. to order breakfast. It was! We were there Superbowl Sunday and the hotel went to great lengths to make it special- they set up big screens in the main lobby lounge, the poolside restaurant and one in the back of Varita restaurant- we chose the lobby - it was sponsored by Rums of Puerto Rico and there were raffle tickets if purchasing discounted rum drinks. Many peope won t-shirts, Rum, travel mugs and gift basket- it was fun and festive! I really enjoyed my stay thanks to the customer service skills of the management and staff. I own a small Boutique on the CT shore and people come in this time of year looking for resort wear- when we share Caribbean destination stories- I will recommend Condado Plaza for service and value. I plan to make this long weekend and annual event. I do have one negative about my stay which the hotel has no control over- except the impression on its visitors- we walked Ashford Avenue the first afternoon- leaving the lobby the first thing we saw was the abandoned, graffittied, crumbling building next door, it made me sick to see such a sight- so sad in fact we turned around and went right back to the hotel. A special Thanks to Carlos from housekeeping and Michelle from poolside restaurant.
reviews.title: customer service A+

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here a night after a cruise. I was not not overly impressed with this hotel. We had a bay view room, which was adequate. Just to clarify, the hotel has 2 towers on opposite sides of the street. The tower on the bayside seems to be used for conventions. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was large. The pool area needs refurbished. There are 2 pools, the nicer of the 2 is the "party" pool and not very relaxing. The lobby is very modern and appears to be well kept. Marisol, at the concierge desk, was very helpful. She helped us pick the perfect restaurant for our friend's b-day (Marmalade in Old San Juan). I would stay here again if just for one night, but not an extended stay.
reviews.title: Just okay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When first entering the hotel its look is very modern and bright. The staff was very friendly throughout our stay. We never had any problems with our room or service at all. My fiance and I thought the shower and bed were the best amenities at the hotel. One thing I was slightly disappointed with was the size of the beach. They don't really show you how small it is online but it was never a problem. Whenever we were there it was not crowded and the water was great. The staff was very helpful and accommodating. I thought it a little rude to require hotel guests to pay $11 to rent a umbrella on the beach but there were plenty of shaded areas around.
reviews.title: The bed and view was fantastic!

reviews.text: I read alot of reviews before I booked this trip and the one thing I can definitely agree on is the high price of dining at the hotel. We didnt count on was how expensive it would be to eat everywhere. Whether in Old San Juan or at the hotel, the prices were all very comparable. It just depends on what you have a taste for.
